ratings.comment: "Gene" Phillips is a real gem. I had him for my FIG and was allowed to write a paper about what I wanted. He's really kind, caring, and loves what he does. He's also very knowledgeable not just on art history but feminist topics (his research intersects the two). Hard work but he cares about if like your grade or not.

Professor Philips is great. You do have to show up to class and participate, but if you do its easy. He gives great feedback and will tell you how to improve your paper. There were no exams in this class, but there were a couple papers and reading for every class.
Phillips is a very nice, patient professor. As an international student, he gave me lots of help, both on and off his office hours.

Prof. Phillips is a very nice man and is passionate about what he teaches. His slides are always posted, but not until days after lecture. Also, almost half of the lectures are taught by boring guest speakers. There is quite a bit of reading to do to prepare for each lecture and section, and the two exams are both written and non-cumulative.

I love him! He's a really nice guy and is very approachable.  Knows what he's talking about and is clearly passionate about what he does.  He is good about repeating important material and makes lectures interesting.  The only thing I didn't like about this class is that there were several guest speakers who weren't very interesting or coherent.
Super nice and enthusiastic about the topic. I looked forward to getting up every morning for class. Not intimidating at all and I would love to take another course with him.
Clear, funny, sweet and smart. The perfect professor! If you're interested in the material or are looking for a good 300 class to fulfill a requirement then I'd recommend him in a heartbeat!
He's very clear about what he expects from his students when it comes to essays and exams. Very funny and sweet. If you don't mind memorizing lots of names and dates, then take his class!

Very likable, and he always showed great enthusiasm each lecture, even when he had mild pneumonia for the entire semester. One of my all time favorite professors. A fair bit of reading but nothing ever overwhelming,and the lectures were truly fun to go to. Tests were short essay format and were very fair.If given the chance, take any of his classes

Excellent educator, very kind man, clear speaker with a strong voice, and willing to entertain modern media. A perfect professor to have during your first semester. The class uses a class reader, including translations by the professor!
